endpoints.name: Create an order
endpoints.description:
Create an `Order` object.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-order)

headers.name: Revolut-Api-Version
headers.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

endpoints.name: Retrieve an order list
endpoints.description:
Retrieve all the orders that you’ve created. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
- Pagination
    

The response contains an array of simplified `Order` objects.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve an order list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order-list)

query.name: limit
query.description: The maximum number of orders returned per page. Used for **pagination**.

query.name: created_before
query.description:
Retrieve orders with a `created_date` < `created_before`. Used for **pagination**. Use the `created_date` of the last order returned in the previous response to get to the next page.

The default value is the current date and time you are calling the endpoint.

query.name: from_created_date
query.description:
Retrieve all orders with a `created_date` ≥ `from_created_date`. Used for **filtering**.

Use the [ISO date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) : `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.SSSSSS]Z`. For example, `2021-02-10T16:59:50.886826Z`.

query.name: to_created_date
query.description:
Retrieve all orders with a `created_date` ≤ `to_created_date`. Used for **filtering**.

Use the [ISO date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) : `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.SSSSSS]Z`. For example, `2021-02-10T16:59:50.886826Z`.

query.name: email
query.description:
Retrieve all orders that have this `email` associated to them. Used for **filtering**. 

This parameter is case sensitive.

query.name: merchant_order_ext_ref
query.description:
Merchant order ID for external reference. Use this field to filter and retrieve all the orders that have this ID. Used for **filtering**. 

This parameter is case sensitive.

query.name: state
query.description:
Retrieve all orders with specific states. You can pass several states. Used for filtering.

If multiple states are selected, for example `AUTHORISED` and `COMPLETED`, orders with either of the selected values are returned. 

The parameter is case sensitive.

endpoints.name: Retrieve an order
endpoints.description:
Retrieve the details of an order that has been created. Provide the unique order ID, and the corresponding order information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order)

headers.name: Revolut-Api-Version
headers.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

endpoints.name: Update an order
endpoints.description:
Update the details of an order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Update an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-order).

headers.name: Revolut-Api-Version
headers.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

endpoints.name: Capture an order
endpoints.description:
Capture the funds of an existing, uncaptured order. When the payment for an order is authorized, the order is captured and sent to the processing stage.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Capture an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/capture-order)

endpoints.name: Cancel an order
endpoints.description:
Cancel an existing uncaptured order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Cancel an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/cancel-order)

endpoints.name: Refund an order
endpoints.description:
Issue a refund for a completed order. A refund can be either full or partial.

You can initiate a refund for an order only when it is in the `COMPLETED` state.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Refund an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/refund-order)

endpoints.name: Pay for an order
endpoints.description:
Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Pay for an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/pay-order)

endpoints.name: Create a customer
endpoints.description:
Create a customer that has the information in the body of the request.

endpoints.name: Retrieve a customer list
endpoints.description:

endpoints.name: Retrieve a customer
endpoints.description:
Get the information about a specific customer, based on its ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-customer)

endpoints.name: Update a customer
endpoints.description:
Update the attributes of a specific customer.

endpoints.name: Delete a customer
endpoints.description:
Delete the profile of a specific customer.

endpoints.description:

query.name: only_merchant
query.description: Boolean. If `only_merchant` is set to `true`, you retrieve the payment methods that were saved for the merchant (saved_for: "MERCHANT").

endpoints.description:

endpoints.name: Pay for an order
endpoints.description:

endpoints.name: Retrieve payment details
endpoints.description:

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve payment details](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payment-details)

endpoints.name: Retrieve a payout list
endpoints.description:
Retrieve all the payouts you made from your Merchant account. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
    
- Pagination
    

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a payout list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payout-list)

query.name: limit
query.description: The maximum number of payouts returned per page. Used for pagination.

query.name: from_created_date
query.description: Retrieve all payouts with a `created_date` ≥ `from_created_date`. Used for filtering.

query.name: to_created_date
query.description: Retrieve all payouts with a `created_date` ≤ `to_created_date`. Used for filtering.

query.name: currency
query.description: ISO 4217 currency code in upper case.

query.name: state
query.description: Retrieve all payouts with specific states. You can pass several states. Used for filtering.

endpoints.name: Retrieve a payout
endpoints.description:
Retrieve the details of a payout. Provide the unique payout ID, and the corresponding payout information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a payout](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payout)

endpoints.name: Retrieve a dispute list
endpoints.description:
Retrieve all the disputes linked to your Merchant account. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
    
- Pagination
    

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a dispute list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-dispute-list)

query.name: limit
query.description: The maximum number of disputes returned per request.

query.name: from_created_date
query.description: Retrieve all diputes with a `created_at` value ≥ `from_created_date`.

query.name: to_created_date
query.description: Retrieve all diputes with a `created_at` value ≤ `to_created_date`.

query.name: state
query.description: Retrieve all disputes with specific states. You can pass multiple values.

query.name: payment_id
query.description: Retrieve disputes related to one or more payments based on their IDs.

endpoints.name: Retrieve a dispute
endpoints.description:
Retrieve the details of a dispute. Provide the unique dispute ID, and the corresponding dispute information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-dispute)

endpoints.name: Accept a dispute
endpoints.description:
Marks a specific dispute as accepted. After accepting a dispute, you cannot challenge it.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Accept a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/accept-dispute)

endpoints.name: Upload evidence for a dispute
endpoints.description:
Allows uploading a single evidence file for a specific dispute. Use these evidences to provide proof for claims when challenging a dispute.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Upload evidence for a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/upload-dispute-evidence)

endpoints.name: Challenge a dispute
endpoints.description:
Allows challenging a dispute with a reason, comment and associated evidences. Use the uploaded evidences to provide proof for the challenge.

A dispute previously accepted, cannot be challenged.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Challenge a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/challenge-dispute)

endpoints.name: Create a new report run
endpoints.description:
Start generating a new report of the relevant transactions.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create a new report run](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-report-run)

endpoints.name: Retrieve report run details
endpoints.description:
Retrieve details of a report run, based on the `report_run_id`.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve report run details](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-report-run-details)

endpoints.name: Download report file
endpoints.description:
Use this endpoint to download the generated report file.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Download report file](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/download-report-file)

metadata.description:
# Introduction

As a Revolut Business customer, you can use the Merchant API to accept online payments (Card Not Present) by debit or credit cards, and also to manage the orders and customers.

This Postman collection lets you try Revolut's Merchant API.

To see the full documentation of the Merchant API, visit: [Revolut Docs - Merchant API](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/merchant-api).

## Authorization

Each Merchant API request must contain an authorization header in the following format to make a call:

``` json
"Authorization: Bearer <yourSecretApiKey>"

 ```

Use the predefined environment variables (`secret_api_key`) in Postman to authorize your API calls. Make sure to use your Sandbox and Production Secret API keys with the corresponding environments!

Select the environment you want to use in the top-right corner.

To learn more about authorization, see: [Merchant API - Authorization](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/merchant-api#authorization).

### API versions

We highly recommend using versioning in your API calls. If you don't provide a version header on the operations where it's required, you will receive an error response.

The Merchant API uses request header versioning. Where it is required you need to use the `Revolut-Api-Version` header parameter to specify an API version. Each request, where it is indicated in the API specification, must contain a version header in the following format:

```
 'Revolut-Api-Version: 2023-09-01'

 ```

For more information, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)
